Single event run_0

Jul 13, 2017

Single event study

  • Studying one single event hadronized 100 000 times –> This event has mBB = 333 GeV, hence not passing the nominal VH(bb) selection … to be replaced with another ME.

Nominal event

Color Reverted event

Reminder of the selections

  • [ ] Here remind the cuts applied

Colors

| Sample | Color | | ————— | —— | | ppzgvvb | Blue | | ppzgvvbb_revert | Violet | | ppzavvbb | Green |

Loose selection

Leading jet

Jet radius = 0.4

Jet radius = 0.7

Jet radius = 1.0

Sub-leading jet

Jet radius = 0.4

Jet radius = 0.7

Jet radius = 1.0

Conclusion

The larger is the jet, the sharper is the dTheta distribution

Tight selection

(with coarser binning)

Leading jet

Jet radius = 0.4

Jet radius = 0.7

Jet radius = 1.0

Sub-leading jet

Jet radius = 0.4

Jet radius = 0.7

Jet radius = 1.0

Conclusion

  • Large change in shape for the tight selection, sub-leading jet with radius 1.0
  • Missing statistics in tight selection phase space ?
  • [x] Check : what cut is removing that many events ? The only difference being the parton shower, either all events should pass, either none of them …
    • The mBB invariant mass was 330 GeV, hence nominal Matrix Element did not pass the cut 110 GeV < mBB < 140 GeV
